articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects New Nampho Glass Bottle Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects New Nampho Glass Bottle Factory
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the newly built Nampho Glass Bottle Factory. 
					 He went round the room dedicated to the history of the factory, products show room, combined production control room and various other places of the factory to learn in detail about its construction and equipment and production there. 
					
					 Watching varieties of bottles being churned out from work sites in an endless stream, he was greatly satisfied to learn that a modern glass bottle factory was successfully built in a brief span of time and started mass production. He praised the workers of the factory and builders and their helpers for their feats performed in building such factory requiring cutting-edge technology by their own efforts with home-made equipment and indigenous technology. 
					
					 All the processes of the factory from raw material feeding to packing and forwarding are streamlined, he said, expressing great pleasure at the appearance of another structure conducive to improving people's standard of living. 
					
					 The factory is a glass goods producer with a very bright prospect and good profitability as it produces glass bottles for diverse uses with raw materials found in abundance in the country, he added. 
					
					 He said that the workers of the factory and party members and other working people of its relevant units could complete the construction of such factory in a short span of time by displaying ardent patriotism and creative ingenuity, firmly convinced that Korea can do anything, when determined. This shining success demonstrates the indomitable mental power of the Korean people to build a thriving socialist nation by their own efforts and with locally available resources without fail, he noted, adding that this represents a great victory of the WPK's policy of attaching importance to science and technology and the DPRK's self-supporting national industry.
					
					 He set forth important tasks to serve as guidelines for operating the factory.
					
					 The factory is the shining fruition of the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance which its officials, workers and technicians enshrined as faith, he noted, calling on all the people to fully display the above-said spirit and thus thoroughly establish Juche in all fields of revolution and construction at all times and solve all the issues by themselves.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kang Yang Mo, chief secretary of the Nampho City Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam and Hong Sok Hyong, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, and Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Sangwon Cement Complex
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Sangwon Cement Complex
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il read a letter presented by the employees of the Sangwon Cement Complex to him and sent them the following autograph: "Kim Jong Il, January 5, 2011."
					 On Dec. 31 last year they presented him with the letter reflecting their will to operate the complex at full capacity to bring earlier the emergence of a thriving nation, proud of surpassing the peak year of cement production last year.
					
					 They noted in the letter that they honored their cement production plan for last year till October, the 65th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea, that is two months ahead of schedule, and surpassed the peak year of cement production by the end of the year, adding that this was entirely ascribable to Kim Jong Il's wise leadership, meticulous care, profound trust and love. 
					
					 They renewed their determination to wind up as early as possible the overhaul of the production equipment including cement kiln, increase production at their fuel, raw material and power bases and join efforts with related enterprises and thus ensure a satisfactory supply of cement necessary for the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: North Side Sends Notices to South Side
articles.content:
North Side Sends Notices to South Side
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The General Guidance Bureau for the Development of Scenic Spots and the General Bureau for Central Guidance to the Development of the Special Zone of the DPRK on Wednesday separately sent notices to the Ministry of Unification of south Korea and the chief of the Supporting Team for South-North Cooperation Zones of the Ministry as clarified in the important proposal set forth in the recent joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations and the statement issued by a spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea for putting it into practice.
					 The north side in the notices proposed having talks for the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang in Kaesong on February 11 and informed that three persons concerned of the north side would go there. The north side also proposed having working talks on the work of the Kaesong Industrial Zone in Kaesong on February 9. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the north side reopened the Panmunjom Red Cross liaison channel and formally began its work from Wednesday. It also lifted the freezing of the Consultative Office for North-South Economic Cooperation and dispatched resident personages there as practical steps as the south side was informed on Monday. 
					
					 The south side in its verbal notice agreed with the issue of opening the Panmunjom Red Cross liaison channel. But it took such insincere attitude toward the restart of the work of the above-said office, saying it would not send its personnel to it under the pretext of the derailed cooperation and claiming that it is impossible to operate the office and supply electricity to the building. 
					
					 In this connection, the director of the north side to the office in a notice sent to the director of the south side to the office Wednesday termed its intention not to operate even the office after unilaterally scuttling the north-south economic cooperation a very irresponsible attitude. He once again strongly urged the south side to take early practical measures for the regular operation of the office.

articles.title: WPK Greets Vietnamese Party Congress
articles.content:
WPK Greets Vietnamese Party Congress
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Wednesday sent a message of greetings to the 11th Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
					 In the message the WPK Central Committee expressed belief that the Congress would mark an important occasion in providing a new milestone in the work to increase the leadership role and the fighting efficiency of the Party and build powerful and prosperous, socialist Vietnam.
					
					 Hoping that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and the two countries forged in the common struggle for socialism against imperialism would grow stronger, the message heartily wished the Congress great success in its work.

articles.title: Korean People Support DPRK Statement
articles.content:
Korean People Support DPRK Statement
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The recently released statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations has enjoyed full support in the north of Korea.
					 The joint statement contains a landmark proposal for wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations with their south Korean counterparts. What is the main point of the statement is that under the present situation, confrontation can never improve the north-south relations but will lead to an armed conflict and war.
					
					 Metal Industry Minister Kim Thae Bong told KCNA that if the north and south continued to antagonize each other, the victim of the confrontation would be only the Korean nation and the profiteer would be others. When the two parts of Korea join hands and make an effective use of resources abundant in the country, it will become a reunified nation, dignified, powerful and prosperous.
					
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, said if the north and south discussed all crucial issues of the nation through dialogue and negotiations to seek an agreement and implement it, they would be able to smoothly solve many issues related to interests of the nation and its development, peace and prosperity.
					
					 Kim Kang Ho, a department director of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, said that antagonism and confrontation in the same nation should no longer be allowed.
					
					 Ri Ung Il, first secretary of the Youth League Committee of Kim Il Sung University, called on the young people in the south to pool efforts with those in the north and launch a nationwide movement for the country's reunification.

articles.title: Motto of Korean People
articles.content:
Motto of Korean People
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial issued by leading newspapers of the DPRK says, "Fight and create as befit the descendants of President Kim Il Sung -- this is the Korean people's motto."
					 Kim Il Sung is the founder of socialist Korea.
					
					 The Korean people venerate him, who rendered great services to the nation, as the eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 His services have been carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people, under Kim Jong Il's wise leadership based on the Songun (military-first) politics, have successfully accelerated the building of a thriving nation as befit the descendants of the President.
					
					 They try even what others think is impossible, create world-shaking things and do everything in a far-sighted way so that it can bring benefits to the coming generations. This is their disposition, spirit and working manner.

articles.title: Ulmil Pavilion
articles.content:
Ulmil Pavilion
Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Ulmil Pavilion is standing on Moran hill in Pyongyang.
					The pavilion is on an embankment erected almost vertically with well-trimmed stones. 
					
					It, dating back to the period of Koguryo, was built in the mid-sixth century as a northern commanding post of the wall around Pyongyang. It was rebuilt in 1714. 
					
					The 11-meter-high embankment has battlements on its top.
					
					The pavilion has a hip-saddle roof and double eaves. 
					
					From the pavilion, one can get a view of surrounding scenes.
					
					From long time ago, the landscape around the pavilion has been called one of the eight scenic views in Pyongyang.
					
					The pavilion is marked with the Korean people's struggle against invasion. Pyongyang people fought there against Japanese invaders in period of the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598).
					
					The pavilion is one of the places frequented by holidaymakers in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Japan's Preparations for Reinvasion under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Preparations for Reinvasion under Fire
Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The Japan "Self-Defense Forces" are contemplating staging a joint command post exercise with the U.S. forces under the signboard of "joint defense of their southern border" from January 20 to February 3, according to a foreign press report.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					The above-said drill planned by Japan from the outset of the year in the wake of the ceaseless joint military exercises conducted by it with the U.S. warlike forces last year is aimed at finally examining and rounding off its preparations for reinvasion and putting its scenario into practice.
					
					The commentary goes on:
					
					Japan has long stepped up its moves for its conversion into a military power, getting ready to launch overseas aggression. It is now set to achieve its sinister goal by tightening the nexus with the U.S. for aggression under the signboard of a "joint defense".
					
					By staging joint military exercises with the U.S. Japan seeks to strain the situation and launch reinvasion, taking advantage of it. Pursuant to this scenario, Japan is deploying its mobile strike forces made up mainly of its naval and air SDF in the southwestern region of Japan close to the Korean Peninsula and China.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries may kick off overseas aggression anytime. The DPRK is made its primary target. They are kicking up a frantic military racket against the DPRK in pursuance of their scenario for staging a comeback to Korea. The projected joint exercise can be interpreted as part of that scenario.
					
					The Japanese militarists' adventurous moves for reinvasion are rendering the situation in Northeast Asia tenser and increasing the danger of war as the days go by.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries are making desperate efforts to realize their wild ambition for overseas aggression by accelerating the conversion of Japan into a military giant but this will get them nowhere. Their reinvasion will only lead to their self-destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Urged Authorities to Accept DPRK's Proposal
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Urged Authorities to Accept DPRK's Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The present "government" of south Korea should accept the DPRK's proposal for north-south dialogue. This was urged by the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a statement on Jan. 7. The same urge was made by the Media Headquarters and the Academic Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration in a joint statement issued on the same day.
					 The South Headquarters said in the statement: The "government" should face up to the reality, open-heartedly accept the north's proposal for dialogue and opt for dialogue and negotiations. If it refuses to accept the proposal, it cannot but be accused of being a war criminal and sycophant.
					
					 It stressed that the South Headquarters would make all efforts to help all the political parties and organizations positively respond to the north's proposal.
					
					 The Media Headquarters and the Academic Headquarters in their joint statement said that peace and prosperity of the Korean Peninsula are possible only through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 The statement urged the present "government" to roll back its policy of confrontation, opt for dialogue with the north and positively push ahead with the moves to resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang and boost economic cooperation and exchange, etc.

articles.title: Philippine President on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Philippine President on Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- It is necessary to boost the relations between Philippine and the DPRK in the political, economic and other fields, said Philippine President Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino, when receiving credentials from An Song Nam, DPRK ambassador to his country, on Jan. 4.
					 He hoped that the two countries would make concerted efforts to achieve common prosperity.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Call for North-South Dialogue
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Call for North-South Dialogue
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Organizations of overseas Koreans issued statements on Jan. 7, urging the south Korean authorities to actively come out for north-south dialogue.
					 The European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) and the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany in a joint statement warmly hailed the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK. The statement clarified the important proposals for tiding over the crisis prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and between the north and the south of it and opening a new phase for peace and reunification.
					
					 The destiny of the country and the nation can never be an object of bargain, they said, contending that the south Korean authorities should not miss the last chance to discharge their mission for the nation though belatedly.
					
					 The Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia said in its statement that the important proposals made by the DPRK are the most fair and realistic, timely ones in view of the present status of the north-south relations.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have no reason to refuse to respond to the proposals, it said, urging them to drop their policy of dependence on outside forces as soon as possible and come out for north-south dialogue in the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 Meanwhile, a spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China in a statement on Jan. 8 said that nothing is more important for the Korean nation than to achieve national reunification. The authorities, political parties and organizations of south Korea should come out for dialogue at an early date to terminate the tragedy of division forever, he urged.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The Finnish Communists' League, the Guaranda Institute for the Friendship, Culture and Solidarity of Ecuador and the France-Korea Friendship Association made public statements in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					 The Finnish league in a statement on Jan. 5 expressed full support for the will of the DPRK to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula laid down in the joint editorial and sent firm solidarity to the Korean people in their anti-imperialist and independent stand.
					
					The Ecuadorian institute in a statement on Jan. 4 expressed belief that the Korean people would attain their targets as instructed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to bring earlier a bright future of a thriving nation by bringing about uninterrupted innovations and advances, confident of victory.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association said in a statement on Jan. 6 that it would wage more dynamic solidarity activities to support the Korean people's just cause of building a great prosperous and powerful nation and achieving national reunification.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Come out for Dialogue with DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Come out for Dialogue with DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Switzerland and India and an official of an international organization expressed support for the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations.
					 The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a joint statement on Jan. 6 said that the joint statement of the DPRK is very just as it was prompted by the noble aim to save the north-south relations from collapse and achieve the reunification of the country.
					
					 The statement noted that if all the Koreans in the north and the south opt for talks in the patriotic spirit and common interests, irrespective of ideology and political view, the danger of a war will be removed from the Korean Peninsula and the independent and peaceful reunification of the country be achieved.
					
					 The All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association in a statement on the same day urged the south Korean authorities to immediately accept the important proposal of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations for defusing the grave danger of a war prevailing on the Korean Peninsula, preserving peace and achieving the reunification of the country and opt for dialogue and negotiations without delay.
					
					 Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, in a statement on Jan. 6 said that the dialogue and negotiations proposed by the DPRK to the south Korean authorities, political parties and organizations is a landmark and important step to defuse the tensions on the Korean Peninsula and open a bright prospect for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The confrontation which may lead to armed clash and war can never improve the present north-south relations, the statement said, urging the south Korean authorities, political parties and organizations to positively respond to the DPRK's proposal and not to miss this golden opportunity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la Fabrica de Botellas de Vidrio de Nampho
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la Fabrica de Botellas de Vidrio de Nampho
Pyongyang, 12 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la Fabrica de Botellas de Vidrio de Nampho construida nuevamente.
					En su recorrido por la sala de presentacion del historial, la de exposicion de muestras, la de control integral de produccion y otros puntos de la fabrica, averiguo en detalles el estado de construccion, equipamiento tecnico y produccion.
					
					Al ver las botellas de distintos tipos, que se producen sin parar en los talleres, se puso muy satisfecho de que esta moderna fabrica, que requiere de las tecnologias de punta, haya sido construida magnificamente en un corto tiempo con los equipos, tecnologias y fuerzas nacionales e iniciado la produccion en serie.
					
					Evaluo altamente los meritos de la clase obrera de la fabrica, constructores y voluntarios.
					
					Senalando que en esta fabrica de nivel sofisticado forman una cadena automatica todos los procesos desde la entrada de materias primas hasta embalaje y la expedicion, se mostro contento por la creacion de otra riqueza que contribuira mucho al mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Esta base productora de articulos de vidrio resulta rentable y tiene grandes perspectivas porque produce las botellas de distintos usos con las materias primas abundantes en el pais, destaco.
					
					La clase obrera de la fabrica, los militantes del partido y trabajadores de las unidades relacionadas pudieron terminar en un corto plazo la construccion de esta fabrica del nivel sofisticado porque trabajaron con gran patriotismo y creatividad y con la inconmovible conviccion de "!Corea decide, lo cumple!", senalo.
					
					Este orgulloso exito significa una gran victoria de la indoblegable fuerza espiritual del pueblo coreano, dispuesto a construir a toda costa una gran potencia prospera socialista con las fuerzas y recursos naturales propios, la politica del partido de dar importancia a la ciencia y la tecnica y de la industria nacional independiente de nuestro pais, asevero.
					
					Al presentar las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en la administracion de la fabrica, ratifico que ella es el fruto del espiritu revolucionario de autoconfianza que deviene la fe de los funcionarios, obreros y tecnicos coreanos, y destaco que se debe seguir usandolo plenamente para resolver por cuenta propia todos los problemas preservando siempre el caracter independiente en todos los sectores de la revolucion y la construccion.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kang Yang Mo, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Nampho, Kim Ki Nam y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC y Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il firma carta de los empleados de Complejo de Sangwon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il firma carta de los empleados de Complejo de Sangwon
 Pyongyang, 12 de enero (ATCC) -- Luego de ver la carta enviada por los empleados del Complejo de Cemento de Sangwon, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il puso asi su firma en ella: "5 de enero de 2011.            Kim Jong Il".
					 En su carta remitida el 31 de diciembre del ano pasado, los empleados expusieron su alegria por haber superado hasta finales del ano pasado el nivel del ano en que se ha establecido el record en la produccion, y su decision de producir mucho mas para llevar a feliz termino la causa de construccion de la gran potencia prospera.
					
					  Precisaron que han cumplido con dos meses de adelanto, o sea, hasta octubre, en que se celebro el 65o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el plan anual de produccion de cemento.
					
					Tal exito se debe a la sabia direccion y minuciosa atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien confia y ama mucho a la clase obrera, apuntaron.
					
					  Juraron terminar lo mas pronto posible la reparacion de equipos productivos incluyendo el horno de cemento, incrementar la produccion en las bases de produccion por cuenta propia de combustible, materias primas y energias y proveer en lo suficiente del cemento necesario a la construccion de la gran potencia prospera en estrecha cooperacion con las empresas relacionadas.

articles.title: Enviados otra vez avisos a la parte Sur
articles.content:
Enviados otra vez avisos a la parte Sur
Pyongyang, 12 de enero (ATCC) -- De acuerdo con la propuesta importante presentada en la declaracion conjunta del gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y con la declaracion del portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria para ponerla en practica, la Direccion de Desarrollo Integral de Lugares Famosos y la Direccion General de Desarrollo Central de Zonas Especiales enviaron avisos el dia 12 por separados al Ministerio de Reunificacion y al jefe del grupo de apoyo a las zonas de cooperacion Sur-Norte del mismo ministerio del Sur de Corea.
					 Segun los avisos, la parte Norte propuso celebrar el 11 de febrero en Kaesong las conversaciones para el reinicio del turismo al monte Kumgang e informo de que acudirian a ellas 3 funcionarios interesados.
					
					  Propuso tambien sostener el 9 de febrero en Kaesong las conversaciones de trabajo relacionadas con la labor de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong.
					
					  Por otra parte, como habia informado el pasado dia 10 al Sur de Corea, la parte Norte reabrio a partir del dia 12 el canal de enlace de la cruz roja en Phanmunjom y comenzo a trabajar oficialmente en el.
					
					Ademas, tomo unas medidas de accion como cancelar la congelacion de la Oficina de Consulta de Cooperacion Economica Norte-Sur y enviar a ella al personal permanente.
					
					  La parte Sur dio su asentimiento a la reapertura del canal de enlace de la cruz roja en Phanmunjom. 
					
					  Pero, en cuanto al reinicio de la operacion de la Oficina de Consulta de Cooperacion Economica Norte-Sur, notifico oralmente a la parte Norte que no enviaria a su personal a esa oficina pretextando la cooperacion suspendida y por lo tanto, ella no va a funcionar ni ser abastecida de electricidad.
					
					  En relacion con esa postura tan insincera, el jefe de la parte Norte de dicha oficina mando el dia 12 a su homologo surcoreano un aviso senalando que no operar esa oficina interrumpiendo unilateralmente las labores de cooperacion economica N-S es una conducta sumamente irresponsable.
					
					Igualmente, volvio a demandar fuertemente que la parte Sur tome de inmediato las medidas practicas para el funcionamiento normal de la oficina.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia telegrama de consuelo a su homologo irani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia telegrama de consuelo a su homologo irani
 Pyongyang, 12 de enero (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 11 un telegrama de condolencias al presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, en relacion con que la caida de un avion de pasajeros en este pais asiatico causo gran perdida humana.
					 El remitente expresa al destinatario y, por su conducto, a las victimas y los familiares de difuntos profunda simpatia y condolencias.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia preparativos de guerra de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia preparativos de guerra de Japon
Pyongyang, 12 de enero (ATCC) -- Segun fuentes extranjeras, las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon pretenden realizar del dia 20 al 3 de febrero el ejercicio de oficiales del Estado Mayor junto con las tropas norteamericanas bajo el rotulo de "defensa conjunta de las fronteras del Sur". Pero, en realidad, este entrenamiento tiene por su meta revisar y ultimar los preparativos para la reagresion a ultramar que vino impulsando Japon al paralelo de sus pasos para convertirse en una potencia militar.
					A lo largo del ano pasado, Japon ya habia librado sucesivamente los simulacros conjuntos con las fuerzas belicosas norteamericanas.
					
					Revela asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este miercoles y prosigue:
					
					Japon intenta agravar la situacion desarrollando los ejercicios militares conjuntos con EE.UU. y aprovecharlo para provocar la nueva guerra.
					
					En ese contexto, emplaza concentradamente en la zona suroeste, proxima a la Peninsula Coreana y China, el colectivo de ataque movil cuyo grueso es "Fuerzas Navales y Aereas de Autodefensa". 
					
					Es una cuestion de tiempo el inicio de agresion al extranjero por parte de los reaccionaros japoneses y su primer blanco sera la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. El inminente ejercicio de oficiales del Estado Mayor de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" forma parte de los preparativos para la reagresion a Corea.
					
					Debido a los aventureros movimientos de los militaristas japoneses, se torna cada dia mas tensa la situacion del Nordeste Asiatico y se agranda el peligro de guerra. 
					
					Si los reaccionarios japoneses siguen actuando de esa manera, seran condenados a la muerte y a la destruccion.
